page.title: 20PEOPLE IN BASSINGBOURN
page.content: The wheelchair in our transport survey on page 6 belongs to{Kelly Chapman.}It is used so she can get around and move up and down. We raised money for it by having a sponsored walk, jumble sales and so on. The bulk of the money came from the nearby Barracks. The firm that designed the chair is called Everaids. The actual name of the chair is an Everaid Turbo, built at Papworth Industries 10 miles away. Kelly, aged 8, suffers from spina bifida but the good news is that she is able to come to our school. {Ian Martin, Simon Ford, Julie Darnell, {Rachael Hallett, Andrew Rutherford, {Joanna Furlong, Daniel Clay, Tom Lewin {Jude Hodgson, Nicholas Tebbs, Richard {Penny, Chris Davies, Justin Wood, Pam {Qualter, Claire October Colin Chalkley {Mark & Anna Simpson, Kerry & Gary {Lewis}wrote the Domesday Project.
